name: Yemen Cafe & Restaurant
address: 1816 Hylan Blvd, Staten Island, NY 10305, USA

reviews.text: What a delicious and fun time! It was our first time trying Yemini food, and wow. The manager personally guided us through our order, and it was amazing, every dish more delicious than the last. Trust that your curiosity will be well rewarded.

Food is incrediblly underrated and staff so friendly.
Definitely a hidden Gem.

Great to have Yemen Cafe finally in Staten island. I think this location can do so much better with a few tweaks. The portions were much smaller than the Brooklyn locations. I still think they have great potential to improve. One of the main things I dislike is the type of oil used is processed oil that is highly inflammatory and unhealthy. The soup and bread made fresh are really good. I had the lamb shank which was soft but could be a lot more tender like I have had in the Brooklyn locations. Please have an option for whole wheat bread for people that are sensitive to white flour, plus its very unhealthy. The sauce that comes with salad and soup is really good and packs a lot of flavor. Vegetables Stew that comes with the lamb shank and rice was also good. For the Yemeni tea, please have the sugar on the side as some of us are sensitive to sugar. Looking forward to having desserts on the menu with tea like Sha'ee Adeni. Staff was friendly and welcoming . Overall great d√©cor and wishing the place best for growth and success. I will update my review with batter experiences.

Last time I went there was a hair and a dead bee hair in the salad. When I pointed it out to the waiter, there were no apologies. He just brought me a new one which I didn't want. Still tipped well as its not the waiter prepping food.

Update 12/14/24 Place is open again under the original mgt. Lamb Haneeth (shank) dish price jumped even higher to $32.50. Portion was a bit on the smaller side and we didn't get the 2nd bread with chicken haneeth that we were told we would. Salad was good and Fatah was good as well which is homemade as well. Haisa desert is a hard pass with artificial food coloring. There should be more sauce given on the side when the dish is served so we don't have to wait for it. Great service though. Wish they made the haneeth rice less oilier. Service was good but had to wait a few times to ask for things. Place looks a lot busier than before.

1/25/25 Went for dinner with a friend and still think the black seasome bread and lamb haneeth are the best they have. Great addition to the meal with the salad and the soup! Good addition of Adeni tea to the menu!

10/6/25 Went for dinner Monday night. Party of 2. Got two lamb shank orders. Was a bit disappointed that they were mostly not tender. That is what we came for. The bulk of them were not soft which is a deal breaker to pay such a high price for as it keeps going up. Now $32+. I hope they can get better and have the same level of tenderness as the OG Brooklyn location. Otherwise I would have to stop going.

10/11/25 Went in for dinner with a friend on Sat night. Asked the server about specific cuts and asked for the cut I wanted for tenderness. Server was very nice and explained the differences. If done right, this is a great meal with sides!

5 stars for above and behind customer service and hospitality! They make you feel like family here. They go above and beyond to make sure you enjoy your experience and the food. Very casual, relaxed ‚Äúcafe‚Äù type atmosphere where the focus is on the food and culture. Big portions and very affordable.
The broth soup is to die for. Then the lamb shank is fall off the bone and so flavorful. The fresh baked bread is delicious. Highly recommend.
Excellent food and service looking forward to my next meal there
We did take out twice; the food was excellent; fresh, meat quality was good; the staff there was extremely nice and even gave us complimentary dessert to try!
Delicious and very nice staff!!
I love the food, very simple but to the point.
I ordered chicken kebabs delivery, it was yummy and reasonably priced.
Wow Loved the food, great flavors.    It was great but the music...not so much.     I look forward eating here again!

We traveled 1.5 hours to come eat here and have been going to there bay ridge Brooklyn location for years. This new location is more amazing and spacious with the same amazing foods that the entire family will enjoy. We as a family highly recommend Yemen Cafe & Restaurant to everyone. Try the best dish called Haneeth. Wow, you will keep going back to get more. The staff is extremely friendly and the place is extremely clean.
It's hard to describe with words I wish my taste buds had hands they will write more words to describe the taste. It's amazing. If you got to read my review, I hope you get to try and share your own experience and taste.
If you visit enjoy that's what life is about.
Great food and service. Love the free tea and soup.

Nice place very spacious if you‚Äôre going with people.
The food is very delicious especially Hanith and entry soup

Best Yemeni restaurant in all of New York. Great atmosphere and amazing food. The service is  exceptional.
Great food, friendly service
The best experience in my life . Best food and best place
Best restaurant in NYC, 10/10

Amazing! Top notch Yemeni food!
I have tried their food at all their three locations

First and best Yemeni restaurant in NYC. This restaurant and its owners paved the way to most Yemeni business owners and entrepreneurs. It will always hold a special place in our hearts and we‚Äôll forever be grateful.
Delicious food very consistent I highly recommend this place
I eat in that restaurant in Brooklyn I love that food so I thought that restaurant in station island is that same is nasty I spent over $170.00 I will never come back and I don't recommend it
BEYOND BELIEF. Will be coming here all the time from now on!!!!!
Excellent food and great service. Their fahsa, soup, and breads are super delicious. This location is bigger than the one on Atlantic Ave and has free parking in the back.
So deliciouseüëçüèª service was great. Nice and cozy

Food is amazing, bread is to die for and the serving size is HUGE

Everyone there was amazing and sweet and service is impeccable
Amazing atmosphere & amazing coffee!

Update 1 - 2 Stars - September 2024
Major disappointment this time around. Probably won‚Äôt try this location again.

Original review: 5 Stars - June 2024
Yemeni food is one of the my favorite cuisines. So much flavor and the taste is simply amazing!
I have dined at their other locations around NYC and this was my first time at this location.
They did not disappoint! Amazing food, great service and staff were friendly and attentive.
We had dinner here on a Tuesday night and the place was packed. You probably will need reservations for weekend dinners.
I absolutely love this place!

I had the Foul for my appetizer, Lamb Haneeth for my main meal, Fatah with honey/kishta for dessert. Trust me this is the best combination. Lamb is very tender, moist and super tasty. Location is the staten island.
Excellent taste, my boyfriend and I really enjoyed our food. So much too, soup and salad ü•ó üòã we have lots of leftovers! Will definitely be back for the delicious food.

I went to Yemen Cafe before it closed and reopened. I‚Äôve tried their other locations in the city and they weren‚Äôt nearly as good. This place gave a nice big portion of lamb. I haven‚Äôt been in a while so I don‚Äôt know if they changed. Their lamb haneeth is the reason I go, it‚Äôs on the pricier side but they give you a good amount of food that‚Äôll fill you up. It comes with unlimited bread, a side of salad and lamb broth. Their tea is self serve and spiced nicely and tastes amazing too. This place is worth trying out!

Tried this place for the first time after a long road trip. Mashallah mashallah mashallah haven‚Äôt had good Yemeni food like this in a while. The service was fast and always checked up on us. The ambiance was amazing love the interior. The food was great alhamdulilah really enjoyed it the meat was so nice and tender the soup and salad with the bread was all so yummy and fresh. Would highly recommend to check this place out inshallah. Will be back again inshallah!

First time trying Yemeni cuisine. This restaurant surprised me. Both food and service are great. They serve Yemen flatbread and soup at the beginning. They‚Äôre free. If you order Hummus that will go really well with the flatbread. Basically entree is lamb and chicken dishes. Portion of entree is pretty big can easily shared by 2 people. I love the Yemen hot tea and our waitress is super nice. I will definitely come back to try different dishes next time.

Yemen Cafe‚Äôs new location and it‚Äôs much bigger, very cute, and has a nice open space. Outdoor seating too. Great food as usual and consistent with the other Brooklyn locations. Had the lamb saltah and my lamb was perfection! And finally got to try their Fattah as dessert. Not too sweet and a nice crunch. Complimentary tea station was prepped very nicely! Came on the Grand Opening and it was a nice time. The bathroom is modeled so nicely and there‚Äôs two! You can watch the lady making the bread here. I really like this location just for its charm.

Was delicious and the meat was so tender it was falling off the bone. The traditional Yemeni bread is so soft, but with a crisp outer layer. They greeted us and gave us soup and tea. So delicious ü§§ it was very interesting that our waiter spoke four languages. I‚Äôd highly recommend this restaurant if you‚Äôre interested in having delicious rice with tendered meat, whether it be lamb or chicken.

I wanted a different taste and I randomly got to the Yemen cafe. The food was good, the service fast and the portions very generous. The decor is rich and the accessibility easygoing. I‚Äôm so glad that I went. It truly was a taste of Yemen üáæüá™

Order a takeout today. The Lamb Haneeth(I can‚Äôt even pronounce the word)is excellent, but even better is the bread and dipping sauce that come with it. The combo deserves five stars!!! First time here, will be back soon.

Very unique taste, first time i ate yemenese food, charcoal grill chicken and fish it was very tasty üòã
They gave complimentary soup and very large naan, it was very tasty and itself like a meal

Amazing food
Amazing service
Came from Philly will come back !!!!!

Delicious food. Great location. Was so happy to hear that they were opening a Staten Island location of this restaurant. Food was amazing just like the Brooklyn location. Would definitely recommend trying you won‚Äôt be disappointed.
Great atmosphere, available parking, very kind and polite staff, and very good quality Yemeni food. Check it out and you will not be disappointed.
Amazing food and amazing service! The service was quick. They give soup, salad, bread, and condiments when you are seated. They have tea made and ready. Food was amazing, fresh and flavorful!

The food is tasty and exquisite. Service was exceptional. We came on the day of the grand opening and it was busy. To our surprise, 50% was taken off our bill. When asked, our waitress explained that it was due to the grand opening. Thank you for that! Definitely recommended!

This is what I personally believe the BEST Authentic Yemeni food in the COUNTRY !!

Have tried all 3 locations and it‚Äôs the same consistency and quality!

If you‚Äôre looking for an exotic dining table experience, look no further than YEMEN CAFE.
They are offering an incredible selection of YEMENI authentic dishes that cater to diverse tastes and preferences. I‚Äôve dined at (yemen cafe1) downtown Brooklyn and (yemen cafe2) baybridge several times and have never been disappointed. Yesterday, I tried the Staten Island branch, the atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the staff is super friendly and attentive,  most importantly the same great taste.
From now on, I'm definitely not paying for Verrazano Bridge to dine again üòÅ.
It‚Äôs truly a must-visit destination for any food lover.

Eating at Yemen Cafe felt like being welcomed into someone‚Äôs home. From the moment we walked in, the owner was so kind and made us feel instantly comfortable. The food came out quickly and every dish tasted like it was made with love.

The hummus with lamb was rich and flavorful, and the shakshuka, a simple egg scramble, tasted exactly like something your mom would make fresh in the kitchen. It was hearty, comforting, and full of warmth. The bread was fresh, soft, and perfect for dipping, and the homemade hot sauce they gave us was out of this world. It had just the right amount of spice and made everything taste even better. The baba ghanoush was creamy and smoky, another standout on the table.

We decided to try the fatah with honey not really knowing what to expect, and it ended up being one of the best desserts we have ever had. It came out warm, sweet, buttery, and completely comforting, almost like the ultimate bread pudding but even better. Every bite just melted in your mouth. Both my husband and I agreed that it easily made it into our top three desserts of all time. If you go, do not skip it!!  I promise you it‚Äôs worth it.

But honestly, what made the experience so special was the way we were treated. It was clear that the people here genuinely care about their guests. At the end of the meal, they have a little self-serve tea station where you can pour yourself a hot cup of tea. It was the perfect final touch and made the whole meal feel even more personal.

We left full, happy, and already planning our next visit :)

Great experience and good food!
I love the mike tea so much!
Big portion that can share with other.

Great selection of dishes. Very generous portions. Haneeth (both meat and chicken) is the easy star of the show. Soup was great and the fresh bread combined everything perfectly. A must visit if you‚Äôre in Staten Island

I drove a friend to the doctor and saw this place while im waiting. I came in for breakfast and this is what i got!!! Amazing and the tea is also so good! Better than a Dunkin run!!!!! I wish they had this place in New Jersey!
Very nice place, utilities are always great, the stuff were so kind, I‚Äôll come again 10/10 ü§ç‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•.

I am a good customer for the one in Bayridge and Atlantic avenue. But the food is here is terrible, the meat is very smelly, the taste is totally different, much smaller portion despite the huge bill, the fahsah was full with fat

Yemen Cafe offers a warm, welcoming atmosphere and incredible, authentic food. Every dish is rich with flavor and tradition. The service is kind, and the whole experience feels genuine and memorable. A must-try spot!
